articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: French police 'hero' dies of wounds
articles.description: A French police officer who swapped places with a hostage in a supermarket siege dies of his injuries.

articles.description: Thousands rally in Barcelona and other cities after a Spanish judge puts five Catalan leaders in jail.

articles.title: Skripal 'regretted being double agent'
articles.description: A former classmate says the spy told him he even wrote to Vladimir Putin asking to come back to Russia.

articles.title: Mount Etna is 'sliding towards the sea'
articles.description: Measurements show the entire bulk of Europe's most active volcano is edging eastwards, Scientists say.

articles.title: Students get stones to ward off shooters
articles.description: The buckets of stones in classrooms could ward off a gunman, says a Pennsylvania school official.

articles.description: Social media giant faces ire of politicians, investors, clients and users after historic data breach

articles.title: US family found dead in Mexican resort
articles.description: Police say the Sharps did not suffer any traumatic injury and no foul play is suspected.

articles.title: Trump 'tried to pay for sex' - ex-model

articles.title: US signs $1.3tn deal to avoid shutdown
